FacilityName: Cedar City Holly Energy Partners Products Terminal

_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Engine, hoses, ESDs, compressor, and analyzer

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
HF Sinclair Midstream (HF Sinclair) - Cedar City Holly Energy Partners Products Terminal (equivalently referred to as Cedar City HEP Products Terminals or Cedar City Products Terminal) in Cedar City, UT is committed to providing a safe work environment for employees and to being a responsible corporate citizen. HF Sinclair believes that excellent performance in the areas of health, environment, safety and security goes hand-in-hand with operational excellence and financial success. In fulfilling this commitment, the Cedar City Products Terminal will comply with regulatory requirements and provide and maintain a safe working environment using acceptable and proven business practices. All HF Sinclair employees will strive to identify and eliminate hazards that could result in injury and illness, damage to the environment, property damage, and security losses.

HF Sinclair promotes health, safety, and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection. These programs include a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning. This summary provides a brief overview of the risk management activities that we have designed and implemented.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

HF Sinclair - Cedar City Products Terminal is a light products, bulk petroleum storage facility used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of Iron County Utah. The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, diesel fuel, and additives.  The Cedar City Products Terminal also operates a butane process in which butane is stored onsite in as many as 40 railcars and transferred to trucks for distribution using portable transloaders. This Risk Management Plan specifically covers the Butane Transloading Process as described above, identifying it as a Program Level 3 process.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS

HF Sinclair's accidental relea

se prevention programs and emergency planning and response programs help effectively manage the hazards posed by the facility's regulated substance to employees/contractors, the public, and the environment. The covered process is regulated by the EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68 and the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29 CFR 1910.119.

The following accident prevention programs are in place at the Cedar City Products Terminal:

01.) Employee Participation
02.) Process Safety Information
03.) Process Hazard Analysis
04.) Standard Operating Procedures
05.) Operator Training
06.) Contractors
07.) Pre-startup Safety Review
08.) Mechanical Integrity
09.) Hazardous Work Authorization
10.) Management of Change
11.) Incident Investigation
12.) Emergency Procedures/Planning
13.) Compliance Audits
14.) Trade Secrets

ACCIDENT HISTORY

As this is a new process/stationary source, there have been no accidents within the past five (5) years as defined in 40 CFR Part 68.42.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The Cedar City Products Terminal Emergency Response Plan provides the essential planning and training for protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency situations. Contained within the Plan are written procedures that outline the actions to be taken for various types of emergencies that could occur in the facility. These emergencies may include: airborne releases of chemical substances, spills to the water or ground, fires, explosions, personnel medical emergencies.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

HF Sinclair is continually striving to make the Cedar City Products Terminal the safest and most reliable workplace possible for its employees, neighbors and community. The facility's focus is safe, reliable, and environmentally sound operations. The goal of Cedar City Products Terminal is to demonstrate continuous improvement in its health, environmental and safety performance. In addition, HF Sinclair will work cooperatively with our neighbors to ens
ure the health, environment, safety and security of Cedar City Products Terminal and surrounding community.
